page.title: 06Bluebell Woods
page.content: This is an urban area and as such has few open spaces apart from the large parks. However we have near the Langside area, a small patch between Bellwood Street and Tantallon Road, the Bluebell Wood. A group from the Manpower Services and children from the local primary school are trying to tidy these woods. They began by picking up all the rubbish and cleared the ground. Following weeks were spent planting trees, bushes and flowers which will be attractive as habitats and food sources for animals and insects. The plan is to return the woods to the wildlife. The children find the work very rewarding although they are often discouraged to find more rubbish thrown about. This is becoming a little easier as more and more people become aware of the childrens work.
